skill.name: py-observability
skill.description: Observability patterns for Python backends. Use when adding logging, metrics, tracing, or debugging production issues.
skill.summary: Observability patterns for Python backends. Use when adding logging, metrics, tracing, or debugging ...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code examples. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution. All code patterns shown are legitimate observability patterns using standard libraries (structlog, prometheus_client, sentry_sdk).

content.value_statement: Production issues are impossible to debug without observability. Silent failures and missing context in errors make incidents last longer. This skill provides patterns for logging, metrics, tracing, and error tracking for Python backends.
actual_capabilities: Implement structured logging with context and request IDs
Set up Prometheus metrics with counters, histograms, and gauges
Configure Sentry error tracking with sensitive data redaction
Create flow tracing for multi-step operations
Build health check endpoints for dependency verification
Add proper error logging with full context and exception details
limitations: Does not install or configure dependencies
Does not modify existing code files
Does not access production systems or metrics
Does not provide hosting or infrastructure

use_cases.title: Add logging to API endpoints
use_cases.description: Implement structured logging with request context for FastAPI or Flask backends.

use_cases.title: Set up monitoring dashboards
use_cases.description: Configure Prometheus metrics and Sentry error tracking for production services.

use_cases.title: Debug production incidents
use_cases.description: Trace multi-step operations and correlate logs by request ID for faster debugging.

prompt_templates.title: Basic logging setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Add logging to a Python service
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up structured logging using structlog for a Python FastAPI service. Include request ID correlation and proper log levels.

prompt_templates.title: Add Prometheus metrics
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to add Prometheus metrics to a Python web application. Include HTTP request counters and latency histograms.

prompt_templates.title: Configure error tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure Sentry error tracking for a Python backend. Include sensitive data redaction and custom context for better debugging.

prompt_templates.title: Trace multi-step flows
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement flow tracing for a multi-step business process in Python. Include step-by-step logging and error handling with context.

output_examples.input: Help me set up structured logging for my FastAPI application
output: Configure structlog with JSON output for production and console renderer for development
Add request ID correlation using contextvars middleware
Set up proper log levels: DEBUG for diagnostics, INFO for business events, WARNING for edge cases, ERROR for failures
Bind request context (path, method, request_id) to all logs in a request
Redact sensitive fields like passwords and tokens before logging

best_practices: Always include request_id and user_id in logs for correlation
Use structured key-value pairs instead of string interpolation in logs
Log with full context when errors occur including error type and message
Redact sensitive data before logging request bodies or user information
anti_patterns: Silent early returns without logging why the function returned early
Logging errors without context (just the error message, no user or request info)
Using unstructured string formatting instead of structured key-value logging

faq.question: Which Python frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns work with FastAPI, Flask, and any Python async or sync framework. Libraries used are framework-agnostic.

faq.question: What logging libraries does this skill use?
faq.answer: Primary library is structlog for structured logging. Can also use standard logging module with custom formatters.

faq.question: Can I use this with Docker or Kubernetes?
faq.answer: Yes. Structured JSON logs work well with container orchestration. Prometheus metrics scrape endpoints easily.

faq.question: Is sensitive data safe in logs?
faq.answer: Skill includes patterns to redact passwords, tokens, and API keys before logging. Always review log output.

faq.question: Why are my logs not appearing?
faq.answer: Check log level configuration, ensure logger is properly initialized, and verify structured log output format matches your log collector.

faq.question: How is this different from other logging skills?
faq.answer: Focuses on production observability with metrics and tracing, not just log formatting. Includes Prometheus and Sentry integration.
